title: (x) Elements Restaurant - (similar to) Neuland, Post Antiqua {Eduardo, Patrick Broderick}
content: I am having trouble identifying these 2 fonts. I am really no good at this! Thanks for helping out... ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25221.jpg)
author: julia

comments.content: Bottom one looks like a imitation of Neuland (perhaps it's an artificially weighted down version?).

The top one looks like a pen script, similar to Agfa's [Lisbon](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=203120) or [Amanda](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=206274).   
   
I can see that neither of these is exactly the same, but if we don't come closer those may be substitutes.
The top line looks to me like Post Antiqua, only with the "M" digitally squished and the rest of the characters slightly extended.

Franko Luin's [Ad Hoc](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504/http:/www.identifont.com/show?2P6) is alos fairly similar, as are some of the fonts Agfa has of Philip Bouwsma's like [Trieste](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5JF) and [Corvallis Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142504/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5EB).   
   
I'm afraid I'm running out of places to look. It may also be hand-lettered (not a font), as another possibility to consider.
I agree with Patrick. Post Antiqua is the best match I've seen. (I was working on my post when that came up).
